isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL

note.para: Before starting reassembly, make sure the three magnetic discs are solidly in place at the bottom of the case. These can be secured to the disc mounting surfaces with Scotch Grip Rubber Adhesive or equivalent adhesive.

step1.para: If previously removed, press the needle bearing into the bore of the reverse idler gear ( Figure 206).

figure.caption: Figure 206. Press Needle Bearing into Reverse Idler Gear Bore

step1.para: Install the washer on the idler shaft ( Figure 207).

figure.caption: Figure 207. Install Washer on Idler Shaft

step1.para: Position the reverse idler bearing, gear and washer in the transmission case ( Figure 208). Install the idler shaft through the idler gear and into the transmission case bore. Make sure the idler shaft is seated in the bore of the support boss as far forward as possible.

figure.caption: Figure 208. Position Reverse Idler Bearing, Gear and Washer in Transmission Case

step1.para: Install the washer and stop nut on the front of the shaft ( Figure 209). Tighten nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 209. Install Washer and Stop Nut on Front of Shaft

step1.para: Install the pipe plug in the reverse idler shaft ( Figure 210).

figure.caption: Figure 210. Install Pipe Plug in Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para: Install the OUTER RACE of the auxiliary countershaft front bearing into the case bore and against the retaining washer ( Figure 211).

figure.caption: Figure 211. Install Outer Race of Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing

note.para: The bearing INNER RACE is installed on the auxiliary countershaft front and never with the outer race.

Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the keyway of the gear and stamped with an "O" for easy identification. A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.
